parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
Elijah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Helias, an Israelite.
A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and kathistemi; to reconstitute.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To set at naught, ignore, despise. From ek and a derivative of the neuter of oudeis; to make utterly nothing of, i.e. Despise.
